questions.ocrQuestion:
Let \( z_{1} \) and \( z_{2} \) are two non-zero complex numbers such that
\[
\left|z_{1}+z_{2}\right|=\left|z_{1}-z_{2}\right|
\]
then the phase difference between \( z_{1} \) and \( z_{2} \) is
(a) \( 30^{\circ} \)
(b) \( 45^{\circ} \)
(c) \( 60^{\circ} \)
(d) \( 90^{\circ} \)
